solution_line_template: In total, the {num_plants} tea leaf plants have {leaves_per_plant} x {num_plants} = <<{leaves_per_plant}*{num_plants}={total_leaves}>>{total_leaves} green leaves.
One-third of the yellow leaves falling off of all plants is {total_leaves} / {yellow_fraction_denominator} = <<{total_leaves}/{yellow_fraction_denominator}={yellow_leaves}>>{yellow_leaves}.
The number of remaining green leaves on the plants is {total_leaves} - {yellow_leaves} = <<{total_leaves}-{yellow_leaves}={green_leaves_left}>>{green_leaves_left}.
